skillTree.localised_description: Inside this ornate staff decorated with snake motifs is bound a malignant and ancient Serpent Djinn, imprisoned by powerful enchantments woven by Jaffar. Only Jaffar's will is strong enough to temporarily unleash it upon his enemies on the battlefield.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above

contact_effect.onscreen_name:
Serpent Djinn's Poison!
	Damage over time

skillTree.localised_description: Ibn Naggazar was a brilliant, if somewhat maniacal Arabyan sorcerer. Whilst it is unknown whether his madness sprang from isolation, too many attempts at creating intoxicating elixirs or the honeyed promises of whispering daemons. There can be no doubt he was utterly mad.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +15
Winds of Magic cost: -10% for overcast spells

skillTree.localised_description: This one ensures that those captured in battle wished they'd died on the field, so great is the cruelty that awaits them.
The enemy of my enemy is my friend. Even if that friend is heavily mutated.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +30 with Chaos Dwarfs, Warriors of Chaos and Norsca
Diplomatic relations: +50 with Oracles of Tzeentch

Assassinate action: Additional 5% success chance
	(all characters)

skillTree.localised_description: Moving tirelessly through the sands of Araby.
Even from within their vessels the Djinn will protect their masters.
The relentless drive and fury of the elemental spirits, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Jaffar's hunger for power knows no bounds. There's no pact he won't make or enemy he won't crush on his path to conquest.

Jaffar condemns all who oppose him to a life of slavery. Arabyans, Estalians, Bretonnians, Greenskins, no matter who or what they are, all enemies of Jaffar are to kneel before the Great Sultan and serve him.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -30% for Sharkas Slave and Pit-Fighter units

skillTree.localised_description: The Black Scimitar Guard is Sultan Jaffar's personal elite bodyguard. They are devoted to their Sultan and aligned with Jaffar's goals of Arabyan dominance.

effects.description:
Melee Attack: +5 for Arabyan Guard and Sipahi
	(Lord's army)

Melee Defense: +5 for Arabyan Guard and Sipahi
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Jaffar possesses a compelling charisma with which he has been able to sway many Arabyan tribes and city-states to his side.
"Nothing will stop me, not the Northerners, the Elves, the Dwarfs, Settra's lackeys or anyone else! I will rule this world, or see it burnt to ashes around me!"

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Humans
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Dwarfs
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Dark Elves
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "No land shall remain beyond my grasp. No kingdom shall be beyond my mandate. Go forth. Conquer. Rule."

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Spirit Leech"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Spirit Leech Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Spirit Leech Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A conjured shadow is just as obfuscating as a real one - the Shadow Wizard is master or mistress of the 'concealing' arts.
By invoking the Element of Fire, one of the caster's hands becomes burning hot, which he can use to smite enemies.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Burning Hands"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Burning Hands Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Burning Hands Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Soulblight Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A spectral pendulum is summoned by the Wizard. On command, it swings, razor sharp and with lethal speed, through the foe.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Penumbral Pendulum"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By invoking the Element of Water, moisture rises up from the very rocks and sand, turning the ground into deadly quicksand.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Quicksand Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The spellcaster opens a vortex leading into the Pit. Anything caught within it will be lost forever.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Pit of Shades Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Warriors of great armies are decorated in ornate armour taken from the Sultan's personal armory, even the slaves!

effects.description:

skillTree.localised_description: The sand dunes are so large that a man can only cross them with his trusty mount.

skillTree.localised_description: Hit and run tactics work especially well in the desert. That's why the horsemen of Araby are particularly skilled marksmen.

skillTree.localised_description: Years of training and fighting in the scorching desert sun creates exceptionally tough fighters.

skillTree.localised_description: The powerful Djinns and various other monstrous creatures are fielded to destroy the enemies of Araby.

skillTree.localised_description: In the arsenals of the Sultans are countless powerful guns capable of firing devastating volleys.

skillTree.localised_description: Veterans among the settled peoples, or "hadir", of Araby are able to be bestowed with titles and finery befitting their contribution to these great lands.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Slave Rabble, Warriors, Spearmen, Bowmen, Corsairs, Pit-Fighters, Palace Guards, Arabyan Knights, Camel Cataphracts, Scorpion, Grand Bombard and Naphtha Thrower units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Slave Rabble, Warriors, Spearmen, Bowmen, Corsairs, Pit-Fighters, Palace Guards, Arabyan Knights, Camel Cataphracts, Scorpion, Grand Bombard and Naphtha Thrower units (Rank 7 and above)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: You have seen many brothers fall in battle, for that is what the nomads are, my brothers.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Nomad Trackers, Jezzails, Southlands Warriors, Camel Lancers, Desert Riders, Camel Archers and Camel Jezzails units (Rank 7 and above)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: You are wise in the ways of magic and have much to teach others.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Dervishers, Enchanted Ropes, Genie, Desert Spirit, Fire Efreet, Sea Nymph, Tempest Djinn, Flying Carpets and Djinn Carriage units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: They call him the beast whisperer, for these creatures would truly die for him.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Waghzen, Elephants, War Elephant and Feral Giant Vulture units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Waghzen, Elephants, War Elephant and Feral Giant Vulture units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: +15% for all beast units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
Every wound that is not fatal is but a lesson to learn from.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: Whether out of fear or conviction, this leader is able to rally a relentless force behind him.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

ui_effects.localised_text: Casting spells depletes your Winds of Magic power reserve

factionEffects.localised_description: Jaffar has reclaimed the throne of Al Haikk and ushered in a new age of magic and trade. His enemies shall tremble!

effects.description:
[HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
	(all armies)
Jaffar's Revenge: Enact Jaffar's Revenge by uniting all of Araby and conquering all of Estalia, Tilea and Bretonnia. Each milestone provides various rewards
Diplomatic relations: -40 with Chevaliers de Lyonesse, Thegan's Errantry, Knights of the Flame, Knights of Origo and Jerrod's Errantry

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Due to his charisma and his power over the Djinns, he managed to unite the nomadic tribes of the desert and formed the Sultanate of Araby.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Guardian" for Palace Guards units
	(Lord's army)

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

effects.description:
Upkeep: -50% for Arabyan Guard units
	(Lord's army)
